mdRecord.dcterms:title: Whereas by the 28th article of the indented agreement made on the 20th February, 1795, by and between Robert Morris, John Nicholson, and James Greenleaf: and those who might become purchasers, owners, or holders of shares in the North American Land Company .. it was agreed
Alterations proposed to be made in the original articles of agreement and association of the North American Land company
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: North American Land Company.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Title from first paragraph of text.

On page 4: The foregoing is a true copy of the alterations proposed to be made in the original articles of agreement and association of the North American Land company, dated 20th February, 1795, as agreed to by a large majority of the share-holders of said company, assembled at their annual meeting in Philadelphia, on the 31st Decem. 1806. James Greenleaf, Secretary of the North American Land Company.

James Greenleaf's copy of the "Alterations"; with his annotated copy of the "Plan of Association" (Philadelphia, 1795) and his copy of a circular letter headed "Office of the North American Land Company ... Philadelphia, June 9, 1806."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: North American Land Company.
Land companies--United States.
